snippet: A law seeks to address the injustice of the 1492 expulsion of Jews, by giving descendants a chance to apply for citizenship; how many may qualify, however, is still unclear.
abstract: Spain's Parliament passes law that offers citizenship to thousands of Sephardic Jews whose ancestors were expelled in 1492; measure takes effect October 2015.
lead_paragraph: A law seeks to address the injustice of the 1492 expulsion of Jews, by giving descendants a chance to apply for citizenship; how many may qualify, however, is still unclear.

headline.main: Spain Approves Citizenship Path for Sephardic Jews
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Europe; Spain: Citizenship Law Is Approved for Descendants of Sephardic Jews
